descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/25370-1-1363658291.png[/img]
[center][i]Realistic Grass Density for Skyrim[/i][/center][center][color=black][i]by MTichenor[/i][/color][/center]

[center][youtube]Kyi49WDoaB0[/youtube][/center]

[heading]Overview[/heading]Have you ever wondered why grass in Skyrim is thin and sparse, and only in tiny clusters?

I do.

That's why I made this super simple mod to increase grass density. It uses the exact same method outlined in [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/3288]Lush Grass[/url] by SparrowPrince. I highly recommend downloading Lush Grass for the increased mesh density. I also recommend [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/141]Skyrim Flora Overhaul[/url] by Vurt. Both of those mods were used in the screenshots here, along with my SkyRealism - ENB Evolved Cinematic Preset.

This mod DOES cost you some FPS. On more modern graphics cards (GeForce 500 series and Radeon HD 6000 series) you'll only notice a 5-10 FPS hit. On older graphics cards, it can be a much higher penalty. If you are experiencing large FPS penalties, you can use a mod which does not increase grass density as much as this mod does (e.g. [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9185]Glorious Grasses[/url]). Alternatively, you can disable shadows on grass via the Skyrim.ini file.

[heading]Installation[/heading]You'll need to make sure that your Skyrim.ini file has the following settings under [Grass]:
[code]bAllowLoadGrass=0
bAllowCreateGrass=1
bDrawShaderGrass=1[/code]
Other than that, simply drop this in your Skyrim Data folder and enable it like any other mod.

[heading]Credits and Thanks[/heading]Thanks to SparrowPrince for outlining how to make this kind of mod, and to Vurt for his amazing grass textures.
author: MTichenor
